meta.title: Monday, April 13, 2020 Coronavirus Update - Bowling Green City Schools

link.title: Preschool Program @ Conneaut ES - News

li.p:
137 Clough Street
Bowling Green, Ohio 43402
Voice: 419-352-3576
FAX: 419-352-1701

a.title: Search
a.style: color: white; font-family: Verdana; text-decoration: none;

span.p: I hope this finds you enjoying a day off after our Easter holiday. Nothing new to report but just a reminder for everyone to do their part in helping slow this virus. Washing hands regularly, wearing a mask if possible when going out in public, wiping off deliveries, etc. are some of the practices to help in this cause. Today’s update is more informational in nature, but I again want to thank you for all that you are doing and the continued support as we travel through this experience together. Please know that we are here to answer any questions or concerns that you may have. I was invited to take part in a drive by birthday celebration for one of our students recently. If any of you are doing something along those lines, do not hesitate to ask our admin or teachers as I am sure we would all enjoy getting out of our homes and be part of a drive by. Seeing our student’s smile made it rewarding for me and my wife and of course our two dogs who wanted to join in the celebration. Stay well and have a great day.

strong.span: VIRTUAL SPIRIT WEEK – PLEASE POST TO FACEBOOK, INSTAGRAM, AND TWITTER

span.p: We would love to see the pictures during spirit week as a way of appreciating each other in a time that we all find ourselves in. Your pics will help brighten everyone’s day and in a small way brings us back to some sense of normalcy.
Post a picture with your at home classmates (pets, siblings, parents, etc.)
Post a picture of yourself in your spring sports or
Post a picture of the book you are reading
Post a picture of your fun family activities

strong.span: WOOD COUNTY DISTRICT PUBLIC LIBRARY - RESOURCES

span.p: During the COVID-19 pandemic, free content is being offered to parents and students from many sources, and now it is more important than ever for readers to find the right books to read. Wood County District Public Library offers free access to NoveList K-8 Plus, a resource that helps readers match their interests with quality reading material.

NovelList K-8 Plus contains lists of recommended reads and award-winning books. It covers both fiction and nonfiction titles for all ages. It also has extra content like reviews, book discussion guides, curriculum guides, and other book-oriented articles. Book groups, teachers, and now parents will find these resources especially helpful. Looking for a list of funny books? NoveList K-8 Plus has a recommendation for that.

Readers can browse by reading interest and age range, or search by specific books to learn more about a particular book or author. Access is free with a WCDPL library card from this link: https://wcdpl.org/dbases/n.

If families need a library card, temporary library cards are instantly available from this link https://wcdpl.org/temporary-library-account and will work with the NoveList K-8 Plus resource. Happy Reading!

As we continue the shelter at home, we are seeing more families being impacted as parents are becoming unemployed. We are in this together and want to remind you that as a district we want to make sure that your student is able to take part in our food service.

p.strong: Any family wanting to take advantage of the breakfast and lunch program being offered, please contact Mrs. Forschner at
. This will allow her to have a food count in order to meet the needs of all our families.

span.p: Another reminder for next the next two weeks: Tomorrow is Good Friday and is a scheduled day off as is Monday, April 13 Therefore:
The food service schedule will be as follows for the next two weeks: Same Times/Location

p.strong: Week of April 13-17 Service will be on Wednesday April 15 only

span.p: Crim Elementary is a grab and go location (Mon-Fri 9:00am – 12:00pm).

ul.li: The Middle School will be a distribution location from 9:30-10:30 am (Mon. and Wed – Look for the bus).
Rudolph – Rudolph Christian Church; Portage – Village Hall;
Sugar Ridge – Sugar Ridge Community Church.
